text: I don't serve all right this is an
Bernhard reporting from Damascus Syria
last month the Syrian government invited
me to interview seven prisoners they had
labeled as vicious jihadist extremists
their testimonies coerced or not and in
no way verifiable are part of a newly
energized campaign to convince the
United States in Europe that they are on
the wrong side of Syria's war so the men
were nervous their jailers monitored
behind the camera refusing to be filmed
one prisoner limped but most said they
had been treated fairly Syrian
government wants the West to see it as a
bulwark against violent jihadists with
potential links to al Qaeda Syrian Prime
Minister while neither Al hulky insists
that America will soon regret supporting
Syrian rebels
tourism and there is an issue
handpicked by the government the seven
prisoners were presented as direct
evidence some confessions were lurid and
extreme weather truth half truth or
coerced and scripted some of the men's
life stories followed a common thread
they said they had few political views
until they were brainwashed by religious
leaders and paid to fight kill and rape
four said they fought Americans during
the Iraq war
some stories seemed selected to
intimidate this man claimed to have
killed a British soldier in Iraq in 2003
[Music]
others were more sedate even off-message
as the stalemated war continues into its
third year the Syrian government will
continue to hold these prisoners as
evidence of a crazed enemies hoping to
redefine its image in a continuously
brutal and cunning war she can do so via
that for the Nexus 9 is not in place
